content.description: Tough and dabby lowball starting in the cave.Establish left hand on a 1 pad edge with a small sharp thumbcatch, right hand undercling on a 3-ish finger incut crimp, left foot toehook out the left side of the cave, right foot on a foothold under the lip. Cross right hand over to the face, then hold tension and bring the left over. Work your way up to the edge and top out.
content.protection: Should be fine with just a pad under the face, maybe a slider or something under the roof if you don't want to get dirty.
content.location: idk man its in the park somewhere i just followed the boys there

content.description: Start right hand on a small 2-3 finger crimp, left hand on a horrible pinch, and put a heel out left before pulling off the ground (you might need to fold a pad to reach the heel). Throw left to a decent sloper, and bump out right. Go directly up for an easy top out.  I'm not entirely sure if this is an FA, but considering the lack of any info at all online I'm just assuming.
content.location: On the middle bulge. the heel is a pretty obvious triangle shaped sloper, and the crimps are pretty close to the ground.

content.description: A small cave with a bunch of spider webs underneath it. Some fun but moderate climbing up the short faces into fairly easy top outs.
